greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of k-element subsets of [n] having a prime element sum; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, s) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n, 0)):
mathematica: b[n_, s_] := b[n, s] = Expand[If[n==0, If[PrimeQ[s], 1, 0], b[n-1, s] + x*b[n-1, s+n]]];
T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, n}]][b[n, 0]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 16}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 21 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 17 2017
